intro: Chamaecytisus jankae, commonly known as the Janka’s broom, is a shrub native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its dense, sprawling growth habit and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has small, leathery leaves and is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
